alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Dubois; Martin; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 11:29AM EDT until April 03 at 4:34AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River from Bedford to Shoals. White River from Elliston to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. White River at Edwardsport. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the White River at Elliston to all points downstream...and along the East Fork White River from near Bedford to all points downstream. Moderate flooding has begun at Petersburg...and will continue along the lower White River through Sunday. The crest on the White River will continue along the Knox...Daviess County line through Friday. Flooding will likely last through Friday along Greene County portions of the White River...and through next week along lower portions of the White River. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass Bedford later today with minor flooding continuing for areas downstream through early next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Shoals. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.5 feet, West River Road east from Shoals flooded in at least two locations. Residential area near McBrides Bluff isolated by high water. Low lying county roads east of McBrides Bluff also flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 22.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Thursday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
